text.style: text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 43.89px; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 43.89px; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
font-family: Khand; text-anchor: middle; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
font-family: Gochi Hand; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: Allies à 0 à la création du personnage. Contrainte des
Stargazers. L'isolement du personnage fonctionne bien avec
cette contrainte, dans le sens ou il a passé toute sa petite
enfance au Pakistan, il a peut être eu moins d'occasion de
s'intégrer, et comme il a un métier ou la sociabilité n'est pas mise
en avant....

text.style: font-family: Khand; text-anchor: middle; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
font-family: Gochi Hand; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: Fetish à 0 à la création du personnage. Contrainte des
Stargazers. Facile d'entendre que le personnage n'est à la base
pas matérialiste, et que c'est dans ses gênes.

text.style: font-family: Khand; text-anchor: middle; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
font-family: Gochi Hand; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: Resources à 0 à la création du personnage.Contrainte des
Stargazers. On partira du principe que tu as toujours souhaité
être indépendant, tu gagnes ta vie de façon modeste mais tu
dépenses facilement pour pas mal de petites choses en
supplément du quotidien (aider le sept, acheter de quoi soigner
des animaux en sus). C'est une contrainte à la création du
personnage, ça peut évoluer ensuite.

text.style: text-anchor: middle; font-family: Khand; font-size: 43.89px; fill: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke: rgb(136, 136, 136); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 24.871px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 24.871px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: -- Silver Fangs gift
Through the blessings of the spirits, the Stargazer’s resolve is
tempered like steel, allowing great feats through application of
sheer will. An ancestor-spirit teaches this Gift.
-- System
Once per scene, the Stargazer may spend one Willpower to gain
two automatic successes on an action, rather than one.

text.style: font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 24.871px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 24.871px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: -- Theurge/Children of Gaia gift
The Theurge channels spiritual power through her hands, mending
the wounds of any other living creature. This Gift may not heal the
werewolf herself, spirits, or the undead. A bear- or unicorn-spirit
teaches it.
-- System
The player spends one Gnosis point and rolls Intelligence + Empathy
(difficulty is the target’s current Rage, or 5 for those with no Rage).
Each success heals one level of Lethal, Bashing, or Aggravated
damage. The healer may even heal fresh Battle Scars (see p. 259) in
this manner, if the Gift is applied during the same scene in which the
scar is received and an extra Gnosis point is spent.

text.style: font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 24.871px; text-anchor: start; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68);
text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 24.871px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.05pt;
text.tspan: -- Homid gift
To creatures of the wild, man’s scent is death. To creatures of the
city, it is authority, comfort, easy meals. This Gift, taught by an
ancestor-spirit, enhances a werewolf’s human scent, infusing it with
spiritual power.
-- System
Non-supernatural wild animals lose two dice from their dice pools
when interacting with the Garou, save when defending themselves
or running away, and will be inclined to flee rather than attack if
possible. Domesticated animals recognize the werewolf as a friend,
and even trained attack dogs will do no more than wag their tails
at the character unless attacked first. This Gift’s effects are
permanently active.

text.style: text-anchor: start; font-family: Gochi Hand; font-size: 24.871px; fill: rgb(68, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(102, 68, 68); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 24.871px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 24.871px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: start; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 19.019px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;
text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 19.019px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

g.text: WaWWoD Cross+Over Sheet 19.05 ©2024, Red Fox Studios.

text.style: text-anchor: end; font-family: Philosopher; font-size: 9.5095px; fill: rgb(34, 34, 34); stroke: rgb(17, 17, 17); stroke-width: 0.5pt;

g.text: Red Fox Studios are a subsidiary of Pentex Inc.
